Vars

verbosityLevel = 3

Consts

debugEnabled = true

Procs

proc critical(msg: string) {....raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
proc debug(msg: string; level: int = 4) {....raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}

Logs a debug message to stdout if the verbosity level is high enough.

This procedure outputs debug information during development and testing. All debug output is automatically disabled in release builds, with no runtime overhead.

Parameters: msg: The debug message to output level: The verbosity level of this message (0-4)

Example:

debug("Connecting to server...", 3) # Only shown at verbosity 3+

proc debugf(format: string; args: varargs[string]; level: int = 4) {....raises: [],
    tags: [], forbids: [].}

Formats and logs a debug message with placeholders if the verbosity level is high enough.

This procedure allows formatted debug output with string interpolation using "{}" placeholders. All debug output is automatically disabled in release builds, with no runtime overhead.

Parameters: format: The format string with "{}" placeholders args: The string arguments to substitute into the placeholders level: The verbosity level of this message (0-4)

Example:

debugf("Connecting to {}:{}", serverName, $port, 2) # Only shown at verbosity 2+

proc error(msg: string) {....raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
proc info(msg: string) {....raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
proc setVerbosityLevel(level: int) {....raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}

Sets the verbosity level for debug output.

Parameters: level: The verbosity level (0-4) 0 = Critical only 1 = Errors and critical 2 = Warnings, errors, and critical 3 = Info, warnings, errors, and critical (default) 4 = Debug, info, warnings, errors, and critical

proc warning(msg: string) {....raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}

Templates

template withDebug(body: untyped)

Executes the given code block only in debug builds.

This template allows conditional compilation of debugging code that will be completely eliminated in release builds. Use this for more complex debugging operations that might have overhead.

Example:

withDebug:
  let elapsed = epochTime() - startTime
  echo "Operation took ", elapsed, " seconds"
